Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application can be converted into an action under s. 18.4(2) of the Federal Courts Act
Governing_Law: Section 18.4(2) of the Federal Courts Act
Application_Facts: Applicant claims insufficient affidavit evidence due to missing testimonies from key individuals
Decision_Outcome: Motion for conversion, examination of additional witnesses, and amendments dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Conversion of application to action, examination of additional witnesses, amendments to the application
Court_Ruling: Motion denied; case to proceed as judicial review without amendments or additional examinations
Defendant_Behavior: DIAND's decision to appoint a third-party manager for financial mismanagement
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged insufficiency of affidavit evidence and need for further witness examination
Legal_Standard: Appropriateness of conversion under s. 18.4(2) of the Federal Courts Act
Assessment_Factor: Adequacy of existing affidavits and cross-examinations
Procedural_Issue: Attempt to convert judicial review application into an action
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 18.4(2) of the Federal Courts Act
Application_Basis: Insufficient evidence due to lack of testimony from key individuals
Governing_Rule: Section 18.4(2) allows conversion if deemed appropriate by the court
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Alleged lack of testimony from key individuals
Cause_Description: Dispute over DIAND's decision to appoint a third-party manager for financial mismanagement
Evidence_Handling: Court found existing evidence sufficient despite claimed deficiencies
Evidence_Assessment: Court assessed existing affidavits and cross-examinations as adequate
Evidentiary_Issues: Alleged lack of key witness testimonies
